programme.title: Pasaules smieklīgāko video kuriozu top 10 3
programme.desc: Ik dienu pasaulē notiek negaidīti, pārsteidzoši, neveikli un smieklīgi gadījumi – īsti kuriozi. Labi, ja tādos brīžos pa rokai gadījusies videokamera, un šie jautrie gadījumi ir iemūžināti. Raidījums apkopojis smieklīgākos video kuriozus no visas pasaules.

programme.title: Pretī nezināmajam
programme.desc: Pieredzējušais piedzīvojumu meklētājs un pētnieks Klifs Saimons meklē patiesības graudu mūsdienu spoku stāstos. Pētot paranormālus noslēpumus dažās no ekstrēmākajām un izaicinošākajām vietām uz mūsu planētas, Klifs cer atklāt, kas patiesībā slēpjas aiz leģendām apvītiem nostāstiem. Havaju salu nakts rēgi, Brūnā kalna gaismas, rugarū, lielā pēda, pazušanas Šasta kalnā Kalifornijā – šie neizskaidrojamie noslēpumi biedē vietējos iedzīvotājus gadu desmitiem. Lai nokļūtu leģendām apvītajās vietās, kur lielākā daļa cilvēku nu bīstas spert kāju, Klifam nāksies šķērsot bīstamus apvidus, peldēt un pat rāpot. Bet zinātnieki, šamaņi, vēsturnieki un aculiecinieki atklās norādes, kas ļaus izprast šos tumšos noslēpumus. Vai Klifam izdosies atklāt, kur mītiem „aug kājas”?

programme.title: Roman Megastructures
programme.sub-title: Using 3D imagery, reconstitutions and interviews with historians and archaeologists, this episode tells the story of Gallo-Roman Paris and uncovers the vestiges of ancient Paris: Lutetia.
programme.desc: We explore three cities that were once part of Julius Caesars quest to grow the Roman Empire; through the use of CGI and expert testimony, we unveil the secrets of these wonders of Roman engineering.

programme.title: World War II: The Price of Empire
programme.sub-title: War explodes across Western Europe. The Germans mobile armour, airborne troops and airpower on the battlefield makes their assault unstoppable. France is ready to fall to the Nazis.
programme.desc: The story of how a world that was centuries in the making was completely remade in years of war. Traditional powers fell from greatness as new forces rose to make the modern world.

programme.title: Secret Weapons: WWII
programme.sub-title: World War II ignited a fierce battle for aerial dominance and drove nations to pioneer secret aircraft technologies; this episode explores the development of early jet fighters.
programme.desc: This series highlights how WWII fuelled technological leaps leading to jet planes and space rockets; each episode delves into different weapon categories and offers insights into wartime engineering.

programme.title: Rise and Fall: The Turning Points of World War II
programme.sub-title: In the aftermath of the Great War, the victors sign the Treaty of Versailles. We begin this series by exploring the 20 years after World War One and the events that led to the birth of World War Two.
programme.desc: Through military campaigns, great battles, retreats, defeats and victories, we examine what decided the affair on and above the battlefields of Europe, Asia and North Africa and in the worlds oceans.

programme.title: Top Ten Warfare
programme.sub-title: The greatest 20th-century commanders understood warfare at both strategic and tactical level; some instilled loyalty in their troops through fear and intimidation while others inspired confidence.
programme.desc: This is the story of warfare in the modern age; from the Spitfire to the stealth bombers of the second Iraq conflict, each episode features ten stories from the conflicts of the 20th and 21st century.

programme.title: Pompeii: The New Dig
programme.sub-title: The excavation of a wealthy villa, bakery and laundry in Pompeii reaches its climax with chilling revelations about what people were doing in the final terrifying hours in A.D. / C.E. 79.
programme.desc: We follow the biggest excavation of Pompeii in a generation; with access to the archaeological and forensic investigation, we also discover what happened to named survivors and find their descendants.

programme.title: Emperor: The Rise and Fall of a Dynasty
programme.sub-title: Claudius rose to the throne but was poisoned by his wife; after his successor Nero alienated Rome, Livia Drusillas dynasty ended with brutal power struggles but having changed the course of history.
programme.desc: Delve into the most tumultuous era in Roman history with the stories of the first five emperors - and the powerful women behind them - told through the eyes of Livia, the matriarch of the Caesar clan.

programme.title: Top Ten Warfare
programme.sub-title: The greatest 20th-century commanders understood warfare at both strategic and tactical level; some instilled loyalty in their troops through fear and intimidation while others inspired confidence.
programme.desc: This is the story of warfare in the modern age; from the Spitfire to the stealth bombers of the second Iraq conflict, each episode features ten stories from the conflicts of the 20th and 21st century.

programme.title: Secret Weapons: WWII
programme.sub-title: World War II ignited a fierce battle for aerial dominance and drove nations to pioneer secret aircraft technologies; this episode explores the development of early jet fighters.
programme.desc: This series highlights how WWII fuelled technological leaps leading to jet planes and space rockets; each episode delves into different weapon categories and offers insights into wartime engineering.

programme.title: Tombs of Egypt: Imhotep, The Pyramid Creator
programme.sub-title: Archaeologist Zahi Hawass hopes to discover the tomb of Imhotep, the architect of the Step Pyramid of Djoser, and aims to unearth the many secrets of the Egyptian mummies with his team.
programme.desc: Archaeologist Zahi Hawass and his team embark on a thrilling quest to find the tomb of Imhotep, the greatest scholar of ancient times and architect of the Step Pyramid of Djoser.

programme.title: Tombs of Egypt: Imhotep, The Pyramid Creator
programme.sub-title: Zahi Hawass is excavating an enclosure called Gisr El-Mudir where sarcophagi containing mysterious mummies and rich painted tombs are discovered; will these treasures lead them to Imhotep?
programme.desc: Archaeologist Zahi Hawass and his team embark on a thrilling quest to find the tomb of Imhotep, the greatest scholar of ancient times and architect of the Step Pyramid of Djoser.

programme.title: Queens of Ancient Egypt
programme.sub-title: Cleopatra II, namesake of the great Cleopatra VII, had an even more shocking reign; she saw her dynasty torn apart by hatred but also saved it from destruction.
programme.desc: The famous Cleopatra is only one in a long line of Egyptian queens spanning 3,000 years of history; we explore the lives of three of ancient Egypts fascinating and charismatic female monarchs.

programme.title: Top Ten Warfare
programme.sub-title: The greatest 20th-century commanders understood warfare at both strategic and tactical level; some instilled loyalty in their troops through fear and intimidation while others inspired confidence.
programme.desc: This is the story of warfare in the modern age; from the Spitfire to the stealth bombers of the second Iraq conflict, each episode features ten stories from the conflicts of the 20th and 21st century.

programme.title: Secret Weapons: WWII
programme.sub-title: World War II ignited a fierce battle for aerial dominance and drove nations to pioneer secret aircraft technologies; this episode explores the development of early jet fighters.
programme.desc: This series highlights how WWII fuelled technological leaps leading to jet planes and space rockets; each episode delves into different weapon categories and offers insights into wartime engineering.

programme.title: Rise and Fall: The Turning Points of World War II
programme.sub-title: In the aftermath of the Great War, the victors sign the Treaty of Versailles. We begin this series by exploring the 20 years after World War One and the events that led to the birth of World War Two.
programme.desc: Through military campaigns, great battles, retreats, defeats and victories, we examine what decided the affair on and above the battlefields of Europe, Asia and North Africa and in the worlds oceans.

programme.title: Tombs of Egypt: Imhotep, The Pyramid Creator
programme.sub-title: Archaeologist Zahi Hawass hopes to discover the tomb of Imhotep, the architect of the Step Pyramid of Djoser, and aims to unearth the many secrets of the Egyptian mummies with his team.
programme.desc: Archaeologist Zahi Hawass and his team embark on a thrilling quest to find the tomb of Imhotep, the greatest scholar of ancient times and architect of the Step Pyramid of Djoser.

programme.title: Tombs of Egypt: Imhotep, The Pyramid Creator
programme.sub-title: Zahi Hawass is excavating an enclosure called Gisr El-Mudir where sarcophagi containing mysterious mummies and rich painted tombs are discovered; will these treasures lead them to Imhotep?
programme.desc: Archaeologist Zahi Hawass and his team embark on a thrilling quest to find the tomb of Imhotep, the greatest scholar of ancient times and architect of the Step Pyramid of Djoser.

programme.title: Queens of Ancient Egypt
programme.sub-title: Cleopatra II, namesake of the great Cleopatra VII, had an even more shocking reign; she saw her dynasty torn apart by hatred but also saved it from destruction.
programme.desc: The famous Cleopatra is only one in a long line of Egyptian queens spanning 3,000 years of history; we explore the lives of three of ancient Egypts fascinating and charismatic female monarchs.

programme.title: Top Ten Warfare
programme.sub-title: The greatest 20th-century commanders understood warfare at both strategic and tactical level; some instilled loyalty in their troops through fear and intimidation while others inspired confidence.
programme.desc: This is the story of warfare in the modern age; from the Spitfire to the stealth bombers of the second Iraq conflict, each episode features ten stories from the conflicts of the 20th and 21st century.

programme.title: Rise and Fall: The Turning Points of World War II
programme.sub-title: In the aftermath of the Great War, the victors sign the Treaty of Versailles. We begin this series by exploring the 20 years after World War One and the events that led to the birth of World War Two.
programme.desc: Through military campaigns, great battles, retreats, defeats and victories, we examine what decided the affair on and above the battlefields of Europe, Asia and North Africa and in the worlds oceans.

programme.title: Secret Weapons: WWII
programme.sub-title: World War II ignited a fierce battle for aerial dominance and drove nations to pioneer secret aircraft technologies; this episode explores the development of early jet fighters.
programme.desc: This series highlights how WWII fuelled technological leaps leading to jet planes and space rockets; each episode delves into different weapon categories and offers insights into wartime engineering.

programme.title: Pompeii: The New Dig
programme.sub-title: The excavation of a wealthy villa, bakery and laundry in Pompeii reaches its climax with chilling revelations about what people were doing in the final terrifying hours in A.D. / C.E. 79.
programme.desc: We follow the biggest excavation of Pompeii in a generation; with access to the archaeological and forensic investigation, we also discover what happened to named survivors and find their descendants.

programme.title: Emperor: The Rise and Fall of a Dynasty
programme.sub-title: Claudius rose to the throne but was poisoned by his wife; after his successor Nero alienated Rome, Livia Drusillas dynasty ended with brutal power struggles but having changed the course of history.
programme.desc: Delve into the most tumultuous era in Roman history with the stories of the first five emperors - and the powerful women behind them - told through the eyes of Livia, the matriarch of the Caesar clan.

programme.title: Vikings: The Making of an Empire
programme.sub-title: King Harald Bluetooth consolidates his own authority among the Danes by choosing to be baptised and convert his people, but power in over-ambitious hands can unfortunately lead to the worst.
programme.desc: We travel a thousand years back in time to chronicle the epic rise and fall of historys first and only Viking empire, a riveting story of three generations that changed the course of history.

programme.title: World War II: The Price of Empire
programme.sub-title: Germany seeks to neutralise British strength from the air in the Battle of Britain. The Luftwaffe has been deterred but the Blitz begins. The Germans move to support their allies in North Africa.
programme.desc: The story of how a world that was centuries in the making was completely remade in years of war. Traditional powers fell from greatness as new forces rose to make the modern world.

programme.title: Secret Weapons: WWII
programme.sub-title: World War II was a battle for supremacy at sea more than any other conflict before or since; in this episode, we explore how the secret weapons of naval warfare changed the tides of history.
programme.desc: This series highlights how WWII fuelled technological leaps leading to jet planes and space rockets; each episode delves into different weapon categories and offers insights into wartime engineering.

programme.title: Rise and Fall: The Turning Points of World War II
programme.sub-title: In this episode, we explore the first few years on the European battlefield, from the invasion of France and the subsequent Dunkirk evacuation to Hitlers betrayal of his pact with Stalin.
programme.desc: Through military campaigns, great battles, retreats, defeats and victories, we examine what decided the affair on and above the battlefields of Europe, Asia and North Africa and in the worlds oceans.

programme.title: Top Ten Warfare
programme.sub-title: What defines a successful fighting force? Warfare has changed radically over the last century, and armed forces have had to adapt to new technologies and tactics.
programme.desc: This is the story of warfare in the modern age; from the Spitfire to the stealth bombers of the second Iraq conflict, each episode features ten stories from the conflicts of the 20th and 21st century.

programme.title: Revolutions That Changed History
programme.sub-title: Led by Spartacus, gladiator slaves escaped Roman rule and sparked a rebellion of thousands; despite victories, the Romans exploited their weaknesses and ended their uprising but their legacy remained.
programme.desc: This series exposes the truth behind ancient revolutions and revolts, from action-packed bloody battlegrounds to the intimate exchanges between confidants that were powerful enough to turn tides.

programme.title: Roman Megastructures
programme.sub-title: Using 3D imagery, reconstitutions and interviews with historians and archaeologists, this episode tells the story of Gallo-Roman Paris and uncovers the vestiges of ancient Paris: Lutetia.
programme.desc: We explore three cities that were once part of Julius Caesars quest to grow the Roman Empire; through the use of CGI and expert testimony, we unveil the secrets of these wonders of Roman engineering.

programme.title: Queens That Changed The World
programme.sub-title: Victoria presided over a period of history which saw huge industrial, social and territorial expansion; she reignited the public love of the monarchy and led the way for modern royals.
programme.desc: For so long believed to be side characters in histories dominated by men, some queens wielded extraordinary power; we discover how six women ruled in ways that far surpassed their male counterparts.

programme.title: Countdown to Surrender
programme.sub-title: January 28th, 1945: the war reaches its climax on German soil. It is the beginning of a hundred days of horror and death, claiming more lives than in all the years of war.
programme.desc: These are the last hundred days of World War ll; we recount crucial milestones in the last days of the Third Reich and its steady decline towards the inevitable capitulation.

programme.title: Countdown to Surrender
programme.sub-title: March 6th, 1945: Cologne is the first German city to fall to the Allies. Stalin plans to conquer Berlin before the other Allies arrive; the Wochenschau stokes up fear of the Red Army.
programme.desc: These are the last hundred days of World War ll; we recount crucial milestones in the last days of the Third Reich and its steady decline towards the inevitable capitulation.

programme.title: Countdown to Surrender
programme.sub-title: April 16th, 1945: the Red Army begins its offensive on Berlin; the first concentration camps have been liberated by British and US forces; on May 8th, the Second World War comes to an end in Europe.
programme.desc: These are the last hundred days of World War ll; we recount crucial milestones in the last days of the Third Reich and its steady decline towards the inevitable capitulation.
